IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: See Schedule O for complete description.Hands On Atlanta tackles Atlanta's most pressing needs by igniting a passion for service and creating lifelong community volunteers. Hands on Atlanta engages volunteers in service across greater Atlanta in partnership with over 100 nonprofit and school partners.
IRS990.MissionDesc: We mobilize the Atlanta community to tackle our city's most pressing needs.
IRS990.Desc: Hands On Atlanta served almost 13,000 K-12 students in fiscal year 2023 through our wraparound education programs, partnering with three local school districts. Fifty-two (52) AmeriCorps members served as tutors and social-emotional learning coaches at 16 partner sites, supporting 462 elementary and middle school students. Two part-time employees supported 24 students who participated in our Discovery after-school program at Center of Hope located at the MLK Recreation and Aquatic Center (Department of Parks and Recreation). Our Discovery program served 542 students focusing on science, technology, engineering, arts, and math along with health and fitness. We proudly provided 12,578 families with snacks or meals through our Meals4Kids program, providing supplemental nutrition before school and holiday breaks.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Hands On Atlanta creates custom volunteer events and programs that connect company employees to nonprofits, schools, and parks that need help.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: In fiscal year 2023, Hands On Atlanta had 181 nonprofit partners in the Hands On Partner Services Program. Nonprofits who participate in Hands On Partner Services have access to Golden volunteer management software to store volunteer contact information, schedule volunteers, and track volunteer hours; can post volunteer opportunities on our website; have access to trainings; and have their volunteer needs promoted through Hands On Atlanta social media platforms and e-newsletters. Hands On Atlanta also provides a Civic Leadership Program. Days of Service include Hands On Atlanta Week and MLK Day where thousands of volunteers serve with our nonprofit partners and schools.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule A, Part II, Line 10, Explanation of Other Income:
Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: Refunds Reimbursements - 2018 Amount: $ 7,460. 2019 Amount: $ 5,871. 2020 Amount: $ 10,835. 2021 Amount: $ 5,991. Refund Health Ins Premiums - Various Rebates - Accrual Reversal - 2019 Amount: $ 22,338.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Hands On Atlanta accounts for uncertain tax positions in accordance with accounting standards that provide guidance on when uncertain tax positions are recognized in an entity's financial statements and how the values of these positions are determined. No liability has been recorded as of July 31, 2023 and 2022 due to uncertain tax positions.

GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.NonCashAssistanceDesc: Education Programs: Discovery: Provides food to underserved students during the after-school enrichment sessions; Volunteer Service Projects: Food for our Meal Packing projects; Family Support & Self Sufficiency's: Meals4Kids: Provides food for students at our most underserved schools.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Jay Cranman, President/CEO, received a discretionary board-approved bonus of $25,000.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 8b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Committees do not have authority to act on the governing body.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Board of Directors reviews the Form 990, for completeness and accuracy, before it is filed with the IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Management requests disclosure of conflict of interests at board meetings.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Board of Directors reviews the accomplishments of the CEO/President against goals on an annual basis as well as salaried data for comparable positions. The CEO/President evaluates the performance of other executives against goals and sets compensation accordingly. The salaries of all non-CEO executives shown on the Form 990 are ratified by the Board of Directors.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Governing documents, conflict of interest policies, and financial statements are available on organization's website or upon request.
The process for auditor selection and review of audited financials has not changed from the prior year.
